docs.snippet: Britain will consider any suggestions to give the body in charge of upholding data privacy laws more powers, Prime Minister Theresa May's spokesman said on Tuesday, responding to concerns about whether Facebook had adequately protected users' data...

headline.print_headline: UK Will Always Consider Ways to Improve Data Laws: PM May's Spokesman
headline.main: UK Will Always Consider Ways to Improve Data Laws: PM May's Spokesman

docs.snippet: The Latest on the Facebook privacy scandal (all times local):

headline.print_headline: The Latest: Reports: Zuckerberg to Testify Before Congress
headline.main: The Latest: Reports: Zuckerberg to Testify Before Congress

docs.snippet: Facebook chief information security officer Alex Stamos is leaving the company in August, a source said on Monday, and a report cited internal disagreements over how the social network should deal with its role in spreading disinformation.

headline.print_headline: Facebook's Security Chief to Depart, Source Says
headline.main: Facebook's Security Chief to Depart, Source Says

docs.snippet: An Austrian man faces a 160-euro ($197) fine for describing police officers as "smurfs" in a warning about speed checks posted on Facebook.

headline.print_headline: Austrian Faces Fine for Calling Police Officers 'Smurfs'
headline.main: Austrian Faces Fine for Calling Police Officers 'Smurfs'

docs.snippet: Britain is very concerned over allegations that the data firm Cambridge Analytica exploited Facebook data to use millions of people's profiles without authorization, a spokesman for Prime Minister Theresa May said on Monday.

headline.print_headline: Cambridge Analytica Data Allegations Are Concerning: UK PM May Spokesman
headline.main: Cambridge Analytica Data Allegations Are Concerning: UK PM May Spokesman

docs.snippet: A graphic retelling of the Irish fin-de-siècle aesthete’s whirlwind 1881 overseas tour.

headline.print_headline: The Literati: Going Wilde in America
headline.main: The Literati: Going Wilde in America

docs.snippet: British data analytics firm Cambridge Analytica is at the center of controversy in the United States and Britain after two newspapers reported on Sunday that the company harvested personal data about Facebook users beginning in 2014.

headline.print_headline: Factbox: Who Is Cambridge Analytica and What Did It Do?
headline.main: Factbox: Who Is Cambridge Analytica and What Did It Do?

docs.snippet: British data analytics firm Cambridge Analytica is at the center of controversy in the United States and Britain after two newspapers reported on Sunday that the company harvested personal data about Facebook users beginning in 2014.

headline.print_headline: Factbox: Who Is Cambridge Analytica and What Did It Do?
headline.main: Factbox: Who Is Cambridge Analytica and What Did It Do?

docs.snippet: Shares of Facebook, Twitter and Snapchat-owner Snap fell further on Tuesday as Wall Street fretted over potential regulatory scrutiny that could hobble the business of the social networks.

headline.print_headline: Social Media Stocks Tumble as Wall Street Fears Regulation
headline.main: Social Media Stocks Tumble as Wall Street Fears Regulation

docs.snippet: Breaking five days of silence, Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg apologized for a "major breach of trust," admitted mistakes and outlined steps to protect user data in light of a privacy scandal involving a Trump-connected data-mining firm.

headline.print_headline: Facebook's Zuckerberg Apologizes for 'Major Breach of Trust'
headline.main: Facebook's Zuckerberg Apologizes for 'Major Breach of Trust'
